comments.body: [~kyolee]: May want to confirm with [~jloza] before working on this, since the create group and the view/edit group  look different enough to warrant distinct templates.

Wireframes are correct. After creating the group, the next page displayed is the single group view, where they can then add users or policies etc. [~kgill], you might want to separate these into two Jira tickets though, one for each function.
[~kyolee]: Just opened GUI-366 for the create group operation.

[~jloza] In the current boto, the IAM group call does not return the "create time" as specified in the wire frame.

The return values are:

>>> r = iam.get_all_groups()
>>> r.groups
[{u'arn': u'arn:aws:iam::963068290131:group/Admin',
  u'group_id': u'AGPAJ3O3FIPZF4F5NUDGO',
  u'group_name': u'Admin',
  u'path': u'/'},
I also informed her of this for users. Just leave that out. She'll have to update the wireframe(s)
OK, AWS must have some secret mojo for getting this for their users and groups. I'll update the wireframes.

Pull request has been created for the update and create group:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/160

More work to be done for the users and policy.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/177

Wrapped the Chosen widget to behave like what's described in the wire frame, Tested on Chrome and Firefox.
Pull request https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/182 approved

policy list can be stolen from single user view.

                            ${panel('policy_list')}

Almost there, nice job! A couple of small things:

* needs title
* fields and labels here in General area are right justified and should not be.
* save changes, cancel, add policy buttons should all be left-justified, please.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/191

Policy Panel commented out due to the error at the moment
[~kgill], can you code review this please and then reassign to me for UX review? It's been here in review for 12 days...
[~jloza] not sure it requires code review, it's been merged into develop already. Feel free to do UX review.
looking great! One small nit: when the ARN wraps it does not stay in its column, but aligns underneath the label that is should be beside. I've attached a screenshot so you can see what it's doing.
[~jloza] Couldn't reproduce the case on both Chrome and Firefox on my MacBook Pro OS X 10.6.8. I'd appreciate it if you could provide us with more details on the condition and environment.
chrome Version 33.0.1750.117 on macbook pro osx 10.9.1
BTW you don't have to assign the ticket to me if you just need me to comment on it.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/koala/pull/231

looks great on QA machine

verification done on mac osx 10.9.2, FF 27.0.1
